$clr_1Alkash Programmer\n$clr_2I need access to the internet. Is there any in the Bar, or perhaps over at Sidorovich's place?
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I have to say, that guard in 100 Rads is such a nice fella. I wish those Duty pricks treated me like that.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Deals on sausage and bread have been real shitty as of late.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2You guys heard that some transport in the Zone still works? Such a thing can be found in the Truck Cemetery, and it doesn't even need any gasoline! What a miracle.

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Ha-ha-ha, the military have got themselves a real shit show right now. They were on some kind of raid and their helicopter got shot at... got ordered to return to base immediately.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Man, again Yantar is full of zombies. Careful there, people!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I keep hearing people mentioning someone called Strelok... Strelok this, Strelok that, Strelok whatever... what's the big deal, huh?
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Don't head into any basements, they're full of mutants! Go around the top!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Get to cover, now. There's a helicopter around the old church.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Saw a group of shady guys, presumably Freedom. They're heading toward the Bar.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Saw a group of shady guys, presumably Duty. They're heading toward the Army Warehouses.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2The military's pinned down in Agroprom, in the central complex!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Wish I had a house for four million! And how many artefacts am I going to have to collect for that?
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Bored... I feel like putting holes in somebody.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Join the Monolith in order to avoid your collective and inevitable fates!

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Yesterday I met an old friend of mine that had been missing. He didn't even recognise me, instead he immediately opened fire! Had to take him out... People, be careful around psy-emissions. Shooting former brothers of yours is not a simple task. At all.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2There was heavy fog in Yantar yesterday, made zombies impossible to spot from a distance.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Garik, get me out of Jupiter. I'm on the road right now, will be at Yanov Station in a second.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I hear Sakharov's got some new detectors!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2A group of five people are moving toward the Barrier, in all likelihood, Monolith. Take measures.

$clr_1Unknown source:\n$clr_2Just saw a big chimera who put a group of stalkers on a spectacular circus show. So you want to wander around, think twice. Turning around and leaving is better than lying here with an opened ass, like what just happened to these poor bastards.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Haha, loser. Why'd you leave your farm? And we've already cashed in.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Two-Three-Seven, we're heading back. Regroup.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Tired... I'm tired of everything... Creatures... Damn stalkers, damn anomalies!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2If any other stalker tries to enter the Agroprom, I'm gonna get Duty to lock him up in the arena cages.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Zhurov, we're out of free hands. We need you and a few other guys to prepare a burial for a couple of bodies. They'll be sent to the south as Cargo 200 in a couple of days.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Fuck this weather. It goes from clear, to rain, to a fucking blowout in just a couple of hours!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Together we shall protect the Monolith!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2The mutants have increased in number, leaving us with no fucking breathing room. What is Duty even up to?
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Know, infidels, that we are strong and you are weak. Run, and we will catch you. Hide, and we will find you.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2What fucker snatched all the loot from my stash? The one in the Wild Territory. I know you're reading this... Prepare your sorry ass.

$clr_1Unknown source:\n$clr_2Peregrine Falcon, watching a shootout. A group of stalkers are fighting a large mutant... can't make out... I'm going to withdraw. Yes, switch the channel to a different frequency, this one is bugged...
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2What's the point, to be dragged somewhere. Uh, there'd better be a bar in the Cordon.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2We'll track the crashed helicopter in the Swamps while no-one's there.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Who the hell trashed my vodka stash?... For whoever did this, wish you'd have choked on it, scumbag!

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2The command of the peacekeeping contingent for the isolation of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone is announcing recruitment into the ranks of the military stalkers: pork, horilka, endless ammunition, and a free burial are all guaranteed.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Any smartass brave enough to enter our territory will be given hell.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Anyone seen flying black smoke in the Wild Territory? Fuck me... Is it some kind of new poltergeist?
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I'm pinned down by a bunch of looters, help me out!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Lukash, we've dealt with the mercs. Heading back as we speak.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Lukash, Duty's over at the farmstead again. Why?
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Army Warehouses. Apparently, there's not a chunk left of the pilots. Someone totally fucked that helicopter.

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I wiped this zone and why did I just come here? Money. Yes, we have fattened with our blood and sweat the cocksuckers in the government, that earn while doing fucking shit, and we are here, obliged to crawl for pathetic crumbs.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Guys, there are some real strange things going on in the Zone. Ever heard stories about top secret experiments?
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Bros, any info on the next blowout?
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2The Swamps are restless today. You can get stuck in the mud, and there are lots of creatures around. They are coming straight from the ground, goddammit.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2We're seeing a wave of mutants coming from the northern gorge.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2We're seeing a wave of mutants coming from the east, presumably from the Darkscape.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2We're seeing a wave of mutants coming from the north-west. See the attached coordinates.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I just spotted a couple of helicopters heading north. Sending coordinates. We'll remain hidden - I don't know what their instructions are.

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2A bunch of helicopters just passed by in the Swamps. What the hell are they up to here? I've heard nothing about any planned sweeps or operations in these areas, and my sources are reliable. Something sketchy's going on... Keep your eyes peeled, boys.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2People! Be careful in the village by the Army Warehouses - a Burnt Fuzz has grown on the pillars!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Anyone been to the Red Forest? I was planning on heading there, seems like there's some good loot to be found.

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2People, I'm looking through my binoculars - seems like a new party of soldiers has arrived! I suggest staying out of sight for a couple of days. They're combing the area, but the Zone's gonna chew 'em up anyway.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I'm in the Swamps, it hurts me... The skin is peeling off, my hair is falling out... What the hell is wrong with me?!

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Some people do not learn anything and don't want to, have they seen too many American films or are they blinded by greed? You tell them about the anomalies, they tell you about the loot - they don't want to think about anything, 'cept for dosh, until their guts get scattered on the branches.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Trust no-one but the Monolith and your fellow brothers. No-one.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2How many hounds are going to keep running around Rostok? When is Duty gonna deal with them already? Man, fuck this. I'm going to find someone who actually keeps their word.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Handing out an exoskeleton for free! And now that I've got your attention - I offer to sell a Wrenched artefact, price negotiable.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Is it safe to pass through the Garbage?!

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Came to the Zone and thought I'd come across new sights to see and lots of mutants to hunt... and what do I get? Guard duty all day long at a stupid checkpoint with jack shit to do!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Seems like the military aren't sending any choppers to the area around Rostok after their last one got shot down.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2We've accessed the southern tunnel of the facility, heading downwards into the underground. The Red Forest is visible from the windows. It's quiet here.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Got attacked by a pseudodog, barely made it out!
$clr_1Sidorovich\n$clr_2Deck yourselves out, eggheads. Brothers, who took care of you at first, who gave you the vodka, eh? Those stubborn scientists? Or uncle Sid? Bring those artefacts to me!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Anyone heard about some new guy at the mercenary base in Pripyat? Seems like he's got some unique equipment you can order.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2You heard about one of the sentries shooting himself? I'm having second feelings about joining the patrol.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I overheard some military discussions. Seems like they're planning an op in Yantar.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Death to non-believers!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I feel like sleeping
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Stalkers, Sakharov is paying decent money for loot!... And is looking for someone to send to Lab X-16. I'm not going there, too risky. Full of psy-emissions... and zombies.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2A pack of dogs is coming at us, sending coordinates
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2You shitheads want a taste of a heat-seeking missile? Who taught you to fire an RPG?
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Damn, who emptied my stash?

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Time for a commercial! You wanna be a real lad in the Zone? Get some dirt on your boot, earning plenty of loot? Live on the cushion? Join the bandits! We've got the one right perspective on the Zone.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Need to leave the Zone, pronto.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Some dude in the Garbage got hold of a pretty rare gizmo.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Sold some mutant parts to Sidorovich, and it seems like I got ripped off, that old fart... People, best you trade with Barman instead.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I'm leaving the Zone shortly, I'm done with it, I can't stand it any longer.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Ha, how many blockheads have rushed to the North in recent times.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Hemul, head to the Bar. Got some work for you!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Rumour has it that there's a controller dwelling inside X-16, and maybe not even one. Several experienced stalkers ventured there yesterday and haven't returned since.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Who are those bozos near the farm in merc gear? I ain't even thinking of goin' near there!

$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Damn rifle jamming on me again, and this is happening right after I took it to the technician from Duty in Rostok! What else could I have expected from an alcoholic? If your gear needs repairing, he's the type to stay away from.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Agh, there's a broken tank somewhere in the Red Forest, somewhere in a thicket. They say there's still a PKM left with a few rounds, but I can't look around for it by myself.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2Did my pockets grow or something? Seems like it...
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2I heard that Kremlin sends their own people into the Zone. It'll be interesting to watch them.
$clr_1Arnie\n$clr_2Fighting at midnight tonight. Don't miss it.
$clr_1Ashot\n$clr_2Attention: I am now at Yanov Station. Don't go looking for me in the Warehouses, fellas. I offer you wonderful products at the lowest prices.
$clr_1Barman\n$clr_2If anyone stumbles upon any documents containing information about the area around the Radar and the Scorcher, let me know.
$clr_1Barman\n$clr_2I'm going to explain this one more time for the boneheaded. There are no programmers in the back room of the Bar that are responsible for any messages you receive on your PDAs.
$clr_1Barman\n$clr_2Are you looking for a drink, a good firearm, a lot of money, and a conversation with reliable partners? Come to the 100 Rads Bar!
$clr_1Swamp Doctor\n$clr_2Egh, Strelok... how I need you right now. I don't even know who else to turn to with my problems.
$clr_1Bolt\n$clr_2I ain't feeling good... Had some canned food, apparently from a warehouse. I looked at the expiration date, and I've screwed up bad.
$clr_1Beard\n$clr_2There's work for anyone willing to get their hands dirty. Come to the Skadovsk.

$clr_1Voronin\n$clr_2If I find out that you take bribes from stalkers passing through the Bar, I'm going to print and sign death warrants for each and every individual responsible before I put it in their coffins.
$clr_1Hawaiian\n$clr_2Hola, ese! Got some work for anyone wandering around Jupiter - come visit the Yanov Station!
$clr_1Hermann\n$clr_2A reminder to all stalkers that it is necessary to subscribe to the newsletter regarding any emissions in the Zone. The information is always accurate and up-to-date.
$clr_1Groza\n$clr_2Prophet, I'm heading back to base. Got tons of artefacts!
$clr_1Gromov\n$clr_2I need tools, come to me if you find anything suitable.
$clr_1Gromov\n$clr_2Guys, where did Zulu go? Nobody saw him?
$clr_1Deserter\n$clr_2Selling army goods! I have a lot of stuff, from unique weapons to ammo as well as armour. Everyone who knows where I am, come up. Whoever doesn't know will never learn.
$clr_1Digger\n$clr_2Need 5-6 stalkers for a raid on the catacombs. As soon as I find my PDA, we'll be on the move.
$clr_1Digger\n$clr_2Gathering people for a raid on the catacombs.
$clr_1Digger\n$clr_2We're in need of two more stalkers for a raid in the catacombs.
$clr_1Zhurov\n$clr_2Enough with the harassment at the perimeter already. We'll be covering the entirety of your village with mortar fire if this doesn't cease.
$clr_1Ivan Pisser\n$clr_2Heard some news: someone wants to get through to the Scorcher once again.
$clr_1Snitch\n$clr_2If you need information, go to the Bar.
$clr_1Snitch\n$clr_2Got a little job for an agile newbie, paying well.
$clr_1Kitsenko\n$clr_2Psss, where can I get a little smoke?
$clr_1Kuznetsov\n$clr_2Combat battalion, knock back some good vodka, raid in 3 minutes! Get the squad ready and move out!
$clr_1Kuznetsov\n$clr_2This morning, five privates were missing from the drill... presumably deserters. I will be grateful for anyone who finds these degenerates.
$clr_1Kurgan\n$clr_2I can modify the firmware in the PDA, look for me in the Bar.
$clr_1Leon\n$clr_2That's enough, quit the spamming.
$clr_1Loki\n$clr_2Hey, Duty, how are you doing without Jupiter? Good thing your founder's little backstory got revealed.
$clr_1Baldy\n$clr_2The bandits showed up again in the Dark Valley, not good. We'll eradicate them.
$clr_1Makar\n$clr_2If only I could leave this mess, buy a flat in the city, and get some work in a studio.
$clr_1Maslyak\n$clr_2I heard it again from the speakers at the checkpoint. Someone's laughing louder and louder, laughing more aggressively, like a maniac.
$clr_1Maslyak\n$clr_2I can't do this any more. Every day, the blood in my veins chills.

$clr_1Lukash\n$clr_2Free stalkers! Our men at the Army Warehouses welcome you at any time. Here, you will find true friends and comrades, good attitudes, and much more! The Zone is our home: reflect on whether you see yourself outside the Zone and help us deal with Duty once and for all.
$clr_1Butcher\n$clr_2I always have a job for a good hunter. Come to the flea market.
$clr_1Father Peter\n$clr_2Let us pray, brethren, for the peace of the soul of Yuri Semetsky! Amen!
$clr_1Petrenko\n$clr_2Third squad, the raid to catch monsters for the arena has not been cancelled! Come on, get out of the Bar! Do you want to be like those anarchist weirdos?!
$clr_1Petrenko\n$clr_2Everyone! The delivery of ammunition has to be conducted at the specified hours! Do I have to spend the night here?!!
$clr_1Petrenko\n$clr_2There is work for the veterans, we pay a considerable sum.
$clr_1Petrenko\n$clr_2There's work for free stalkers, adequate payments.
$clr_1Petrenko\n$clr_2I'm offering a job to shoot mutants.
$clr_1Petrenko\n$clr_2I purchase artefacts for research, come visit the Duty outpost at Rostok. If there's no money, I'll trade for something else.
$clr_1Petrenko\n$clr_2Everyone on the parade grounds on the double. Whoever misses it will be discharged from Duty immediately.
$clr_1Petrenko\n$clr_2We're having temporary difficulties with maintaining the private channel. If you need something, write to me personally.
$clr_1Gunpowder\n$clr_2Sanya, are you seeing this too? What's this dumb fuck doing near the bushes? It's been three freaking days! Can I bust his ass already?
$clr_1Gatekeeper\n$clr_2Once again for those "particularly gifted": do not go to the bridge in the DL, our snipers will calm you down instantly. Limansk is under the Syndicate's control.
$clr_1Limpid\n$clr_2Guys, if you find any toolkit, bring it to me! I got basically nothing.
$clr_1Limpid\n$clr_2Anyone who's out hunting... you grab some PDAs for me, we can deal.
$clr_1Rogovets\n$clr_2Here we go again, the vodka ran out again, that's it. How can I treat the nerves of the guys without it?
$clr_1Romka\n$clr_2I require a stalker, who's a specialist in code locks and with experience in raids in the North of the Zone.
$clr_1Peregrine\n$clr_2Die, scum.
$clr_1Sakharov\n$clr_2We require parts of rare mutants for further research. We pay well for every good sample. Those who are interested, come to the mobile bunker in Yantar.
$clr_1Sakharov\n$clr_2General, could you send another five of your men? At the agreed price.
$clr_1Sakharov\n$clr_2Dear stalkers! Our research requires a large number of new artefacts, as many as you can bring. More than a decent payment guaranteed.
$clr_1Senka\n$clr_2Oh, I'd love me a cold beer right now... Anyone knows where to get some?
$clr_1Sergey\n$clr_2To whoever has tools for basic, fine, and calibration work: bring them to me.
$clr_1Sidorovich\n$clr_2There's always work, both for the rookies, and for the veterans. Payment as usual, heh.
$clr_1Sidorovich\n$clr_2Rookies, come to me for work - you can gain experience, earn some money and purchase ammunition.
$clr_1Sidorovich\n$clr_2The life of an entrepreneur in the Zone is as dangerous as a stalker's. I'll reward everyone who ensures the safety of my business.
$clr_1Skinflint\n$clr_2If you want some brand-new, foreign weapon, come to me.
$clr_1Skinflint\n$clr_2We've got some good pot. Come and get some, let's chillax for a bit!
$clr_1Skinflint\n$clr_2If you feel like going on a raid, you can stock up at my place. Also got some dirty work, anyone who does it will get a rare artefact.
$clr_1Skinflint\n$clr_2I buy PDAs containing any valuable information, bring everything to me, more money has never hurt anyone.
$clr_1Skinflint\n$clr_2I got hold of some toilet paper. Those who are tired of burdocks, come quickly, stocks are limited.
$clr_1Sultan\n$clr_2Brothers, when you find Sleeper you can put him down for good... but grab his PDA and bring it to me.
$clr_1Owl\n$clr_2Buying PDAs with any valuable information. Bring everything to me, and I'll give as good as one gets.
Cardan:\n$clr_2Ehhhh... Hello everyone. Just woke up, I'm waiting for a drink.

$clr_1Biggie\n$clr_2Anyone else hear that? There's something playing in the Meadow near the factory. At midnight. So creepy, and yet, so horrifyingly familiar. But I can't remember where exactly I've heard it.
$clr_1Fanatic\n$clr_2To anyone who has not yet been in the village - don't miss the unique opportunity of learning the necessary survival skills from me.
$clr_1Fanatic\n$clr_2People, has anyone seen Wolf?
$clr_1Fanatic\n$clr_2Need help in sweeping mutants' lairs, contact me.
$clr_1Hakim\n$clr_2Sanya, I'm heading back to base with Snake.
$clr_1Hog\n$clr_2I need some more tools for my work. Any mercenaries who aren't out doing any contracts, please help me out. You won't regret the payment.
$clr_1Hog\n$clr_2Best stay away from the Wild Territory. You won't find anything worthwhile there.
$clr_1Hog\n$clr_2Soon, I'll be replenishing my rock collection.
$clr_1Trunk\n$clr_2We need stalkers with raiding experience deep into the Zone. Payment is appropriate. If anyone's interested, contact me and we'll discuss the details.
$clr_1Chechnya\n$clr_2Hunting is cool, I gotta say.
$clr_1Six\n$clr_2Lukash, Duty's at the farmstead again. Why?
$clr_1Nimble\n$clr_2Stalkers! I accept all kinds of PDAs with any valuable information, bring everything to me. The money won't hurt
$clr_1Yar\n$clr_2Hey, Ashot, how's Yanov? Must be cosy, you lousy spoon-fed fighter.
$clr_1Yarik Athlete\n$clr_2There's a sucker in the Dark Valley wandering around with a cool shooter. If someone offs him, I'll buy it.
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2We shall cleanse the world from sin!
$clr_1Anonymous\n$clr_2One day the Zone shall purify this sinful world. Join us to live in a peaceful paradise, or perish with the rest.
burer
cat
snork
poltergeist
bloodsucker
controller
blind dogs
psy-dog
pseudodog
flesh
boars
Burner
Vortex
Fruit Punch
Burnt Fuzz
Electro
Whirligig
Springboard
Tesla
tore his hand off in one of those anomalies, died due to blood loss
bullet wound
broken spine
just some pieces of suit and a beaten PDA
fragmentation wound, apparently, was a heavy firefight
gravity concentration
splashed on the ground... Pseudogiant?
by the look of those wounds, I think it was a snork
tore his leg off, died of a pain shock
the cause of death is unknown
legs look like a horrible mess. Probably a Vortex
open fracture. He could not leave, he laid for a couple of hours... something thoroughly devoured him
broken neck
big cut in the neck
radiation burn
both hands are broken, the neck is folded... what the hell just happened here!
everything covered in some kind of slimy shit. no trace or clue, only found the scraped PDA near this mess... I do not know what it was...
basically a skeleton inside a clean outfit, Gas anomaly?
I found a PDA next to the body, I don't know why the recorder was activated... there's nothing on the record except half an hour of screaming. There's no scratch on the guy... Devil's life I guess
looks like a radiation burn
part of the leg got eaten, probably wild cats
a shot through the leg, died of blood loss
only found the upper part of the body, seems like he walked into a Vortex...
seven holes in the chest. He pissed someone off, didn't he?
there isn't much left from his body, dogs
a horrific look on his face, no wounds at all. I believe it was a controller... who... who's there?!....
Damn, it's really dark now isn't it? Stay close to your camp.
Well, fuck. I'm on guard duty this night.
Everyone stay in your camps.
Screw you and your hunting! At night. Hunting snorks... Fucking psychopaths.
Beautiful night...
Yeah, go ahead, hunting down bloodsuckers in the middle of the night like a bunch of dumbasses.
The moon is gonna be up before long. Damn, I feel something is creeping nearby...
Shit! I can barely see the road...
I heard that chimeras only appear at night... is that true?
No, I'm not going anywhere. It's too late...
Well, pussies, time to start shaking.
Is it supposed to be that dark?
I keep hearing sudden sloshing in the dark. It's better to wander somewhere else...
Tonight, mutant activity here is up to eleven, and, well... so is everywhere else, so everybody, stay in your camps!
I heard that burers come to the surface at night... It's better to catch some sleep in the camp.
These roads are no longer safe.
Okay, return to your camps slowly. The Zone is absolutely not safe at night!
Shit. Guys, do what you want, but I'm not going to look for loot today. Night is coming...
Damn, the sun's already going down... I can already feel something unsettling in the vicinity.
It's during moments like this in the morning that I remember my childhood. My village. You get up so early and watch the shadow and light play in your room... It's unreal. Magical.
Almost like evening...
Bricks were shat all night at the camp. Terrible night!
Fucking burers had a yell fest yesterday. Or... were they fractures?
Can anyone hear me? A group of our guys went missing tonight. Should have been back by the morning. Still nothing. We'll go looking for them soon. Join us.

Guys, you should see what a dawn is on Yantar. This surely is something... scary, and beautiful... Snork corpses drifting in the sparkling surface of the lake in the morning sun, so cool... Romantic...
Guys, wake up! It's morning already!
Guys, it's dawning... It's so beautiful.
Rise and shine, folks. I'm pretty sure we can get moving already, there's not much we could run into. Not like at night.
Finally, the sky is no longer black. I can move with the damn wildlife gone.
It's morning. Moving forward, it's more or less safe now.
A beautiful dawn! As if it were Sevastopol, not the Zone!
Day is breaking...
Egh... I used to have completely different things to do in the morning.
Time to be standing up again, geez.
A terror, not a morning.
Is it morning already? Finally.
Damn, who invented morning?... We've been drinking all night...
Even in this place, beauty exists!
Hey, guys! Finally, dawn has come. I'm tired of shaking in fear in the dark. Better to shiver in the light of day...
Boring day.
It's gonna be a long day, isn't it?
The day hasn't ended yet and I feel tired already...
Gotta finish my contract today, won't wait till night hits the Zone.
I got many contracts to finish today, accepting all this shit at once was a stupid mistake.
It's gonna be a looooong day guys, I can feel it.
Just for your info, controllers roam the surface in broad daylight. Hope that wakes you up.
Finish your work already, unless you don't mind doing it at night.
I shouldn't have stayed up all night, I feel exhausted.
Boars and fleshes go crazy at this time, don't be a hero and go on a hunting trip alone.
The sunset is beautiful.
Who would've ever thought that such a view is possible even here.
The Zone is not that bad after all.
Almost night, finish your work already.
It's gonna get dark soon, stick your asses around the camps.
Guys, watch the sunset... It's so beautiful.
It's a good time to gather around campfires, what you guys say?
Sun is going down, mutants are waking up.
Huh, am I the only one who felt the day was short?
What a view, won't mind sticking around.
The sky is clear today. Sounds like a good time to take on a new job!
I hope the weather stays like this for a while.
The weather is clear. I can see the horizon.
If it wasn't for the radiation, I'd take my mask off just to feel the sunshine.
Who am I kidding? The weather in the Zone isn't always that bad.
The weather is nice. There's no excuse to be lazy.
The sky reminds me of my hometown. I miss those ol' sweet days.
Feels good to be outside today.
The sky is clear enough today, sounds like a good time to take a new job.
I hope the weather stays like this for a while.
The weather is good, I can see the horizon.
If it wasn't for radiation, I would take my mask off on this beautiful day.
Who am I kidding? The weather in the Zone isn't always that bad.
The weather is nice, there's no excuse to get lazy.
The sky reminds me of my hometown, I miss those ol' days.
Feels good to get out today.
Seems like rain is coming.
The clouds are getting darker, seems like it's gonna rain soon.
Feels like it's getting rainy soon.
The clouds don't look that good.
Are we expecting a storm today?
Some people say having cloudy weather all the time is depressing. Personally, I like it this way.
The fog is getting thicker, I can't see shit...
It's not safe wandering around in this fog.
Fucking fog.
Our enemies might take advantage of the bad weather, keep your eyes peeled.
I'm having a hard time making out shit in this fog.
After a second thought, I prefer the rain.
You guys think mutants can spot us in this fog?
The fog is getting pretty thick. Don't stray too far.
Mutants might be hiding in the fog, keep your eyes peeled.
It's raining, boys.
You know what I really need in this rain? A cigarette. Who got some for me?
Let the rain wash your sins away.
I feel like staying inside today.
No thanks, I don't want to get wet today.
I can feel my ass getting wet... Should've bought a better outfit.
You guys think mutants hide during the rain?
The rain is getting inside my mask...
Better stay inside until the storm ends.
Storm? Right when I'm about to do my contract? What bad luck.
When is this storm gonna end?
The Zone is angry at us.
No thanks, I don't want to get wet today.
You know what I really need in this storm? A campfire, a guitar to play next to it, and a bottle of vodka.
Shit, my mask... I can barely see in this storm.
You guys think mutants hide during storms too?
Great... my PDA is wet, just what I need...
I can feel my ass getting wet, should've bought a better outfit.
Hey, one of our guys spotted $who not far from here. There might be more around.
My friend saw $who nearby.
Seems like $who is roaming around the area.
Someone saw $who approaching.
It seems one of those brainwashed guys is wandering around.
You know what to do once you see one of them getting closer.
I hate those freaks.
One brainless zombie shouldn't be an issue. If you spotted hordes of them coming this way, report back immediately.
Big deal, huh?
He's probably just looking for his lost brain.
Hey, one of the guys spotted $who not far from here. There might be more around.
My friend saw $who wandering around. What's the deal?
Seems like $who is roaming around the area.
Someone saw $who nearby, stay alert.
I think I just saw $who approaching, be careful.
We got an outsider. It's not clear, but I think he's $who.
Hey! I'm not sure, but I think I just saw $who nearby.
Be careful, $who is lurking around.
Someone is looking for trouble.
Keep your guns loaded.
If he tries something funny, he's gonna pay for it.
Shit... gotta prepare my gun.
Is that so? Let me know if you see him heading this way.
Maybe they're preparing for something, we gotta be more careful now.
Sounds fishy, can you get a clean visual?
What are those assholes up to now?
If he tries something stupid, open fire at once.
They killed one of my friends the other day, fucking bastards. Let me know if he gets any closer.
We're in trouble, one of our guys spotted $who not far from here.
Is that.... $who over there?....
Shit... it seems that $who is approaching.
Hey, watch out! $who has been spotted not far from here.
Something is wrong, I hear voices in my head.... could be $who lurking around...
Did you hear that! It sounds exactly like $who...
Are you serious?!
For real?! I hate those goddamn freaks...
My head feels dizzy already....
Just thinking about it makes me sick...
Shit... keep your eyes open.
We're in trouble, one of our guys spotted $who not far from here
Is that.... $who over there?....
Shit... it seems that $who is approaching.
Hey, watch out! $who has been spotted nearby.
Be careful, there is $who lurking around.
Hey... guys, you heard that?! sounds like $who... it must be $who!
Keep your distance, and try not to bring it over here. I don't feel like dying today...
Don't try anything heroic. An entire squad got killed by one of these a few days ago.
Well, shit... keep your guns loaded guys.
Oh great... stay alert, it might get close.
I can hear the sound of $who, seems like trouble.
One of our guys has spotted $who, what's your status?
Be careful, there is $who lurking around.
Is that $who in the far distance? Seems like it...
Don't get too comfortable, $who has been spotted not far from here.
Damn... I hate those things.
Is that so? Fine, I'm ready.
Those bastards killed a friend of mine a while ago.
Those freaks are no joke, keep your eyes open.
Seems like $who is getting wild around here.
What is that sound? $who?
Looks like $who is approaching.
Check that out, $who is getting closer.
Big deal, my friend.
Just shoot it.
I prefer to save my bullets for something bigger.
Sounds like a good time for hunting, who's with me?
Don't underestimate it, a friend of mine died to one of those.
I'm out of food, how about we kill it?
Nothing unusual.
Carry on, son.
m.. mma... mon..monooo.... lith
..ha.. hee.... heeel..p.. meeh
yyy...eyh....s.seee... aaar....
.....s..soooo...ooon........eeeeh...
That's what happens when you get caught right in the middle of an emission.
Poor zombie, I think he's trying to communicate.
What's the matter dead guy? Looking for your brain cells?
Remember people: find cover as soon as you see the flares, or you'll end up like your friend there.
Zombies can use the radio?!!
Does anyone understand a word he says?
Hey guys, check this out. Some zombie is trying to say something. How adorable.
What is he even trying to say?!
How cute. You're not trying to invite your dead fellas over here, are you?
I'm starting to feel hungry.
I'm a bit tired.
So, what's next, boss?
What's the plan, $name?
Burers creep the shit out of me. Some say they are the result of secret experiments on criminals, that's how they got their telekinesis powers.
My friend told me once that Pseudogiants are a result of failed experiments in one of those creepy underground labs, and that limbs of actual people got used in the process...
I hope we don't meet those creepy things on the way.
I should upgrade my old gun, it's getting rusty.
Anybody know if an emission's coming soon?
That last emission was a tad too intense.
It's nice to find forgotten bolts in my pockets, you never know when you'll really need them.
I should've hidden my stash somewhere else, some bastard might find it sooner or later.
There's been too many people disappearing lately, without leaving a single trace... The Zone's up to something.
Hey, $name, are you rich or something? Looks like it.
I need a drink.
I miss my family, and my old friends.
Such is life in the Zone.
Watch your step $name, anomalies are all over the place. The last thing I want is a painful death.
Stay away from psi-fields, I don't want to join those zombies.
The encyclopedia says "pseudodogs are mutants descended from wolves"... Then why the heck do they call them "pseudodogs"?
I should have sharpened my knife, you never know when you'll need to stab something.
Believe me when I say this: I don't wanna see a single chimera in my life.
You hear those growls in the distance? That's a bad sign, man.
We should stick close to each other, $name. I got your back.
Maybe it's none of my business, but what brought you here in the Zone, $name?
Freaking psy-dogs can control someone's brain, can you believe that? I'm telling you, I have no plans of being a dog's toy any time soon.
Have you ever heard stories about dark stalkers? They lurk in the shadows, ambush unsuspecting stalkers and drag them away somewhere, never to be seen again...
Sultan is offering new jobs, I need to check them out later.
Got a message from the fellas, they spotted rookies wandering in the Garbage. Heh, we should check out what kind of shit they brought for us.
Eh, $name, my man. You got some smokes?!
The other day, I joined the boys into a hunting trip. Hunting dogs and shit is fun, you know.
Fucking shit, I forgot my lighter...
I was thinking, is hunting artefacts worth it?
Sultan says that we need to stick our asses around, looks like he got new job for us.
Yo $name, got some vodka?! I need something strong.
Once I meet with the gang again, we'll go wild to hunt some asses. Those stalkers always have good shit in their pockets.
Those fucks at Cordon think they own the Car Park, someone needs to teach them how things work here.
One of the boys in Agroprom Underground came back to us the other day. He talked for hours about all sorts of creepy things dwelling in that place. I wouldn't go down there myself.
Duty troops gave our boys at the Garbage a hard time, they want to take control of the area. I hate those scum.
You can never go wrong with hunting eggheads, those nerds usually have expensive detectors and shit.
The bastards from the army think they can order people around. Those jokers can't lay a finger on us, I'm telling ya.
Monolith confuses me. What's your thought about them, $name? Personally, I'm not sure if they got brain cells, or someone's actually controlling them.
I'm tired of hearing stories about Freedom and Duty. To hell with both of them.
There is no law in the Zone, people always seem to forget about this.
Yo $name, let me know if you spotted a lonely stalker wandering around, okay?
Stay sharp, soldier.
I have orders to shoot bandits on sight.
Don't allow intruders to wander around, we must prevent stalkers from passing through.
We got medical supplies from the HQ yesterday, I need to resupply later.
Talk to the commander if you're looking for a job, he might accept your assistance in a few cases.
Being a soldier isn't an easy job, especially in a place like the Zone.
Shit... I forgot my lighter.
We need to get rid of those Freedomers forever.
Cold was offering some jobs, you may want to check them out later.
The old team has screwed up, but we will get our full strength back in no time.
Be careful, bandits may show up at any moment.

Ever wondered what happened to Lebedev and the rest of his troops after the big emission? Cold says they died, but I heard someone say they became Monolith soldiers... \nCome to think of it, it's very possible that they're still alive.
I think I caught a frog in my ass. Staying at the swamps all the time isn't that healthy.
The Ecologists in Yantar supplied us with new detectors and other equipment, this will help our cause.
I prefer to stay away from military checkpoints, they don't go easy on anyone these days.
Many stalkers joined our side as of late, this is good news.
Latest readings showed that emissions are getting stronger as time passes by, what is the Zone up to?
Psi-storms usually don't participate in artefact creation, massive blowouts on the other hand are a different story.
What happened to the old team was unfortunate.
Stay sharp, soldier.
If you've found any artefacts, bring them to the commander. The scientists will make good use of them.
If you spotted any bandit scum crossing the line, shoot on sight. The last thing we need is scumbags wandering around.
The guards at our base say that mutant activity has increased as of late, the Zone is getting more dangerous day after day.
I need to have a nice drink at the 100 Rads.
Have you ever considered the Arena? If you're strong and lucky enough, you can earn yourself quite the sum.
I've just heard that the General has sent new troops to the old farm in Army Warehouses. If those clowns even dare trying to stop us, we'll make them pay.
Those stalkers think wandering around our base is a bloody joke.
Be careful, no-one knows what will show up next. The Zone is full of all sorts of creepy things.
We got reinforcements and supplies from the Ukrainian Army a few days ago, the outfits were not bad at all.
Having affairs with bloodsuckers must be fun enough for our bored Freedom friends.
I have orders to shoot Freedom spies on sight, let me know if you spotted one.
I need to replace my detector, it displays incorrect readings sometimes.
I saw one of the scientists holding a Svarog detector in his hands, it was one of the most beautiful things I've seen in a while.
The Professor is looking for certain artefacts, you might want to help him.
I'm writing a dissertation about Electro anomalies, but I need to collect more samples.
The Ukrainian government approved on sending new equipment, I need to get me a decent anomaly detector.
Despite the amount of artefacts that can be found there, there is no way I'll ever go near Lab X-16. Controllers and zombies roam around the place.
I heard Hermann once mentioning his intentions of hiring a group of mercs to assist our scientists in Jupiter. I concur, many research groups have disappeared lately.
Funnily enough, bolts are still the cheapest and most effective way to detect anomalous activities around.
Many don't know the difference between a Whirligig and a Vortex; the latter has a much larger range. Many have died due to wrong estimations between both kinds.
I heard that the fabled Heart of the Oasis artefact can even nourish the bearer. This is a miracle to science and medicine.
Gas anomalies are rare, but they share similar properties to those of the Fruit Punch.
Burnt Fuzz is the least dangerous type of anomalies. However, stalkers die to it because they don't expect an anomaly above their heads.
Psi-storms usually don't participate in artefact creation, massive blowouts on the other hand are a whole different story.
Stay sharp, Duty scumbags may show up any time.
Voronin keeps sending scouts to that farm over the hill. They never learn, don't they?
Hey $name, if you're feeling sick, let me know and I will let my friend patch you up, you won't regret it.
"Maintaining order in the Zone", best joke I've ever heard.
Monolith forces are giving our guys at the Barrier a hard time. It was never easy actually, I don't envy them.
Gotta admit, Duty did a great job protecting the Bar from the dogs so far. That's impressive.
Yo $name, got a lighter? I left mine in the camp.
I don't mind having the bandits around, as long as they stay out of our way.
There is no law in the Zone, gotta keep that in mind.
Shit, I feel a bit dizzy.
Sooner or later, we will free the Zone from those who abuse its treasures.
To be honest, I don't really feel comfortable about killing all those people. But hey, work is work, and I need to make a living.
The scientists were looking for bodyguards, they're having a hard time dealing with mutants and bandits.
One of my clients asked me to go with him hunting artefacts. I refused, that's not what I was trained for.
Dushman got new contracts for us, I will check that out on my way back.
Being a hitman isn't an easy thing.
If you need something done, I can offer my services... At the right price, of course.
Always go for the squad leader first, this will distract the rest for good.
I can help you with your bounty contracts, we can split the money after that.
Artefact hunting is actually quite common among mercs, especially those who prefer to stay away from killing others.
I always keep a pistol around. You can never go wrong with a reliable, fast sidearm.

I wonder what happened to Scar. You know, the legendary merc who assisted Clear Sky before that big emission, right?\nPeople say he died, others say he became a Monolith leader... Is it possible that he might still be alive?
You can make easy money out of Freedom - Duty conflicts, both offer assassination contracts on each other's targets.
Monolith assassination contracts make me nervous... don't you dare telling anyone that I've said that.
As long as bandits don't interfere with my contracts, I don't mind seeing them around.
Stalkers are usually the easiest targets in the Zone. Sometimes I feel bad about killing one.
My friend found some rare artefacts in Zaton, I need to get a good detector.
Those Ukrainian army bastards think they can order stalkers around. "We are here to protect you from the Zone", my ass.
Man, Sidorovich's prices are unbelievable.
Stay alert, bandits may show up any time soon.
Those bloody bandits think they can stroll around and rob stalkers just like that, they are gonna pay for it.
Hey, let's avoid the military checkpoints, I don't want to commit suicide today.
I haven't decided yet what's best for me. Artefact hunting is profitable, delivery jobs are not that bad either.
Duty and Freedom confused me for a long time, both have got good points and ideals.
I can still hear Duty megaphones inside my head, what the hell...
$name, have you ever considered the Arena? Seems like a good deal.
I wanna visit the 100 Rads Bar. Barkeep's got all sorts of drinks, and I'm in the mood for one.
Moving out from Cordon to Rostok isn't a piece of cake, you can thank bandits for that.
Beard was offering jobs about hunting specific artefacts, too bad I don't own a good detector...
My friend said once to never trust a merc. You might be his friend today, and his contract tomorrow.
I came here looking for work and opportunities, I want throw my old life behind. What about you, $name?
Brother, show no mercy to those who stand against the Monolith's will.
May the Monolith be with you, $name.
We thank you, oh Monolith, for revealing the cunning plans of your enemies to us.
We need to avenge our fallen brothers, let's move.
Clear Sky paid dearly for interfering with the Monolith's plans once, others will follow.
$name, the Monolith has blessed us with wonderful artefacts. Bring as many as you can find to our base.
Be careful brother, the enemy may show up at any moment.
Bring death to those who spurn the holy power of the Monolith.
I'm so used to this place, it's getting really old.
Home sweet home.
Are we staying here for long?
Feels good to be here. Our fellas are guarding the place.
I need to explore the rest of the Zone, staying here won't help.
Been here for quite a long time.
I'm not comfortable with this...
Would you look at this place...
This used to be a town built for the engineers and the personnel working at the Chernobyl NPP...
It was quite a big place once, it is a ghost town now, with mutants and Monolith as the only residents.
The famous Ferris Wheel... it's even bigger than what I imagined.
The former Pripyat Stadium became a battleground infested with Monolith troops.
So visiting this place is your greatest idea?!
We are far behind enemy lines, I hope you know what you're doing...
Get ready for Monolith troops, they will show up at any moment now.
Why did I agree on coming along with you...
Rookies' home, everyone starts from somewhere after all.
The border, I won't mind staying here.
The Ukrainian military guards couldn't stop stalkers from breaking through, after all.
How's that old fat ass doing these days... Still ripping people off I presume.
Stalkers spotted bloodsuckers near the tunnels once. It's not safe, not even here.
One day you see bandits inhabiting the Car Park, next day it's the loners' turn.
The Railway bridge used to be the second gate to the Zone, I don't think the army has control over it any more.
The Mill is a good place to hide a stash, stalkers usually don't stay in there.
If I'm not mistaken, there is a technician in the northern farm.
The situation at the outpost is unstable. Many parties are fighting over it.
This graveyard gives me the creeps, I heard many stalkers vanished while moving between the vehicles.
Would you look at this, what a shitty depressing place.
Duty and bandits have some presence here, but no-one goes too deep.
Stay away from the middle area, I don't wanna be food for bloodsuckers today.
Those tanks and vehicles lying around are quite radioactive, you better have a good gas mask.
Vortex anomalies are common around here, watch your step.
You can hide in the camp in the north-eastern side. It's a good place to stay safe from emissions.
Eh, we got a long road ahead of us.
You know what we really need right now? A freaking car.
Be careful, I feel like something is waiting for us behind those trees.
Bandits usually hide at the bridge, waiting for rookies to show up.
Pseudodogs are quite common here, I hope we don't meet a hungry one.
Looking at the rails, this place used to be a big train station. Now it's just an empty forest.
We can stop by the warehouse to rest for a bit, although I'm not sure who's controlling it.
I hate swamps.
What are we exactly doing here? Watching the frogs?
This place is no joke, walk in the water for a few minutes if you want to join the zombies.
No-one knows what's waiting for us behind those reeds.
The view isn't that bad.
I think I caught bugs in my ass, and staying in this swampy place isn't helping it.
It looks like Clear Sky is back in business. I can't say the same for the Renegades, though.
Did you know, the swamps were not always a marshland. This area used to be a farming region, with villages and fields.
If I'm not mistaken, the pump station was built in order to extract anomalous substances from the bottom of the swamps.
There's a machine yard near the north-eastern part. Renegades used to control the place.
Have you ever been to the old church? It's beautiful yet creepy at the same time.
You can find some stashes in those farms... if you're lucky enough.
I... I can't believe my eyes..... we made it to the centre!
I'm still alive...
The centre of the Zone... the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant is lying right in front of us...
We made it...
After all this time, the Power Planet itself...
The centre... We've finally made it to the centre...
I have never been this nervous in my whole life...
This place is so quiet, and creepy.
Ever wondered what kinds of stuff we can find in those buildings?
Watch your step, a friend of mine once told me about old forgotten mines lying around.
Monolith squads roam the area in the north, they come from the Deserted Hospital.
The mercenaries are having a hard time holding the road to Dead City.
I have a feeling that one day the Monolith will seize control over the whole city.
Zombies wander around the area, it's called Dead City after all.
I wonder if we can find anything good inside those buildings.
The situation here is tense, mercs and bandits are known for fighting each others over the mid area.
The main base for the mercs is here, usually they don't allow outsiders to wander near their hideout.
The statue of Lenin is bigger than what I imagined.
Mercs took control over the sports centre. Bandits got the old school.
You know, the city was stripped of most of its valuables. Now it's an empty shell of its former self.
My friend told me about a tunnel system beneath the city, a whole grid connects every building around.
I can feel the psi-waves already.
The Miracle Machine exists somewhere around here. It's quite dangerous to get in range.
I don't wanna be zombies' soup today, let's keep moving.
When someone mentions Yantar, the first two things that come to my mind are zombies and snorks.
You can try to make your way to Dead City from here, but local mutants may not like it.
Yantar wasn't always a swampy, desolate place you know. A long time ago it was a large lake.
The infamous Lab X-16 is right beneath us, and I don't feel really comfortable about knowing that...
Sometime after the Zone's appearance, Yantar was chosen as a prime location for the mobile science lab...\nNot the best decision if you ask me.
Hearing stories about the massive zombie waves over here, the psi-emitter is probably bigger than what I imagined.
I wonder if there are actual bloodsuckers in that abandoned village... On a second thought, never mind.
Those anarchists roam the area, heard they had a hard time defending the Barrier from Monolith forces, heh.
I would keep my ass away from that village if I were you.
The Warehouses are bigger than I expected them to be. Freedom picked an ideal spot for their headquarters.
Freedom kicked the remaining military units out of here after the big emission, they stormed this place and occupied the area.
Mercs usually control the north-eastern outpost, but they never go further than that.
The farm at the northern side is a nice place to hide, only if there's no other squad over there.
Duty usually send their scouts to the farm on that hill.
Watch your head when you cross the village, Burnt Fuzz anomalies are quite common there.
Comet anomalies usually roam the village. It's normal to find fried stalkers lying around the place.
Be careful, this place is quite dangerous.
Snorks and poltergeists are quite common around here, keep your eyes open.
Stalkers found rare artefacts here. The underground tunnel is known for nice artefacts, but the amount of Electro anomalies there will change your mind.
The mercs are trying so hard to hold that outpost near the tunnel, but they don't always win.
Some of the worst mutants inhabit the mid area, I heard horrific stories about stalkers dying over here...
The tunnel leading to Yantar has Burners and Comets anomalies, basically a big fucking oven!
Keep your eyes on the vehicles around, snorks usually hide between them.
Here you can find either valuable artefacts, or instant death.
What a creepy place.
A while ago, I've heard that a group of stalkers saw creepy creatures coming out from the lab around here. Sounds like a bad deal.
This place has always been gloomy.
There's supposed to be a lab somewhere around here...
Freedom used to control the place before the big emission. When they moved to the Army Warehouses, bandits took control here.
Lots of stalkers died here. This place is no joke.
A friend of mine once told me that Strelok used to have a hideout in the underground tunnels, I wonder what's left of it.
The Ukrainian military controls the area, but that didn't prevent stalkers from sticking around in the utility building.
Duty used to control the research institute before the big emission.
Let's stay out of the underground section, I heard stories about dangerous anomalies and nightmarish creatures flooding the tunnels.
This is one big messy place.
Stay away from the radioactive wastes, I don't want to lose my skin.
What are we doing in the Garbage anyway?
You can never guess what you can find in this graveyard.
Right after the Power Plant's reactor meltdown, whole heaps of radioactive waste were dumped here by the Ukrainian government.
This place swarms with rookie stalkers, with the occasional group of bandits loitering around, always on the lookout for rookies.
There are some artefacts to be found here, but most of them are just not worth the effort.
Loners and bandits are always trying to get their hands onto the best loot, most often leading to fighting and bloodshed.
Bandits have taken hold of the old train hangar for quite a long time now.
There's a Duty outpost to the north, on the path which leads to the Bar. They don't let everyone pass through.
The western side is quite dangerous. Mutants hide between the trees over there, waiting for the next free meal to come to them.
If you're looking for artefacts, your best pick would be the vehicle graveyard, or the radioactive swamp on the other side.
Hey, wanna have a drink at 100 Rads?
Those freaking megaphones are so loud...
Every time I come in here, that stupid guard tells me to get out of here. Does that fucker think he owns the place or something?
That guard at 100 Rads is a good fella, he always welcomes me inside.
I need to buy some food and ammo from the Barkeep, hope his prices are reasonable.
Duty won't allow anyone go near their headquarters.
This place gives me the creeps, keep your eyes open and stick close.
Gotta be extra careful, all sorts of dangerous mutants dwell in this place.
It's easy to vanish without leaving a trace here, no matter how lucky you have been in life so far.
I wonder how's that old guy doing these days.
Anomalies are everywhere in the forest, watch your step.
The forest's gate witnessed heavy firefights between different factions. It was never a quiet place.
You may find some rare artefacts in the old mines, but you should know that few stalkers ever return from them.
The Symbiont anomaly lies deep within the forest. It looks like two giant claws.\nIf the rumours are true, it holds all sorts of artefacts inside its core.
Freedom from the south, Monolith from Radar, bandits at the bridge, stalkers near Forester's tower.\nA usual day in the Red Forest.
Can we stay away from this place...
I have a bad feeling about this.
We are crossing the red line, are you sure about what you're doing?
It's easy to vanish without a trace here, no matter how lucky you have been in life so far.
Whoever gets close to the Brain Scorcher immediately goes insane, turns into a zombie and starts stalking the Zone restlessly...
Is visiting this place your greatest idea?!
I'm a bit nervous...
Monolith squads may show up any second now.
The road is patrolled by Monolith forces and the forest is inhabited by the worst kinds of mutants. It's a suicide either way.
Rare artefacts lie deep in the forest. Good luck reaching them.
Watch out! Those vehicles are highly irradiated, keep your distance.
I can hear voices inside my head...
I... I can't believe my eyes... we made it to the centre!
I'm still alive...
The centre of the Zone... the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant is lying right in front of us...
We made it...
After all this time, the Power Planet itself...
The centre... we've finally made it to the centre...
I have never been this nervous in my whole life...
What an empty place, quite depressing actually.
I wonder if we can find anything good inside those buildings.
This used to be a town built for engineers working at the Chernobyl NPP.
What used to be a booming city once is a ghost town now, with mutants and zombies as its only residents.
I've heard that one of those creepy labs is somewhere around here.
Laundromat became a hideout for stalkers.
This bloody place confuses me... where was the entrance we came from?!
The Monolith used to have a psi-emitter in that school, it's broken now.
Department and grocery stores are nearby, wanna go shopping?
The hospital is probably the biggest building around here. Monolith squads might be hiding in there.
All kinds of creatures roam this big area.
I wonder what's inside that big factory.
Heard once that Jupiter was Strelok's preferred area to operate within the Zone.
Freedom managed to take control over the station, after all.
Jupiter is known for having all sorts of mutants around.
This area used to be an active train station before the accident.
My friend told me some stories about the Jupiter factory. He said that many merc and bandit squads vanished there without a trace...
Do you believe stories about the Oasis?
The rail tunnels are known for being inhabited by creepy mutants, mostly groups of burers. Honestly, I would steer clear from them.
The cooling tower offers one hell of a view. People say that spooky distorted radio transmissions can be heard while passing by.
Kopachy village near the cooling tower is swarming with zombies, not to mention the high radiation levels.
Some stalkers found Soul artefacts in the Concrete Bath Anomaly near the factory, I should check that out too.
See the substation workshops over there? The "Quarry" Anomaly is in the middle, right in the swamp. You'll turn into a skeleton in a matter of seconds if you fall into it.
A few years ago, the Ukrainian Military was investigating helicopter crash sites here. There's one in the factory if I'm not mistaken.
You can go through the abandoned underground tunnels to reach the outskirts of Pripyat. Not a bad choice if you want to avoid going through the city's centre.
You can see the whole area if you climb up the old cement factory. It's a perfect spot for sniping.
They say that the Oasis lies beneath the ventilation complex.

Many people talk about the wonderful Oasis, but it seems that nobody has ever seen it. One of our guys said it's like healing waters. If you walk in, your wounds heal and your energy is replenished...
Bandits hide in the container warehouse because it's a remote location.
I'm not a fan of swampy areas, but this one isn't that bad.
You can find all kind of artefacts here.. and anomalies... and mutants..... Let's just keep moving.
I think I caught bugs in my ass, and staying in this swampy place isn't helping it.
The stalkers at the Skadovsk kicked the bandits out a long time ago.
Zaton is also called "Backwater"... makes sense.
Those rusty ships can save your ass once an unexpected blowout hits.
The trucks on the Preobrazhensky Bridge might contain some forgotten valuables, I should check that out later.
Mercs still hold the waste processing station. They don't allow outsiders to pass through.
Have you seen the Sawmill before? It's usually empty, maybe a few zombies are roaming around.
I heard that many stalkers vanished while exploring the Krug Antenna Complex to the west, better stay away from it...
There's a guy called Noah nearby, my friend told me he tamed a pseudodog! I won't believe him until I see that myself.
Watch out when you go near the fuelling station. Many mutants hide there, and they're usually hungry.
The Claw anomaly here in Zaton is probably the biggest of its kind, not to mention all the goodies inside. But be aware of the snorks flooding the caves nearby.
Ever wondered how the Scar anomaly got carved? Just look at it through your PDA's map.
The Circus anomaly has got a fitting name, getting an artefact from there requires constant jumping. Don't forget to bring a good SEVA suit.
You might find an Electro in the Iron Forest anomaly. Be careful though, poltergeists are waiting for careless stalkers.
Your name is $name, right? You're new around here or something?
$name?... I don't recall you, you're new here?
You haven't spent much time in the Zone, right $name? Seems like it.
Feels good to join a guy who knows what he's doing, $name.
Your name is $name? My PDA says you have quite the experience, glad to have your company.
You're $name?! I heard a lot about your adventures back at our campfire last night. My friends said you're one of the few who survived a while in the Zone.
You're $name, right?! My friends said you're a real veteran.
$name?! People say you're a real hero. Maybe I can learn from your experience.
I can't believe it... the living legend, $name himself!
The legendary $name?! I feel blessed already.
Is this real... It's $name! You have my utmost respect.
You're $name? I've heard that you did some bad shit...
You're $name? You've got quite the "reputation" around here.
$name? I think I've heard about you, some people are quite angry due to your actions.
People say you fucked up big time, $name. What have you done exactly?
$name... I don't recall your name.
Your reputation seems fine enough, $name.
$name, you seem like a nice guy. Are you new around here?
My PDA doesn't show much info about you $name. That's a good thing, I suppose.
You're $name right? I've heard good stuff about you the other day, keep it up.
Your name is $name? I've heard that you help stalkers around, that's so nice of you.
$name? I heard about you the other day, you've got a good reputation among stalkers.
I think I heard about you, $name. My friends said you're good at what you're doing.
People say that you're a man of your word, $name. I'm glad to join your team.
Oh! $what! Right in time to get patched up.
$what. Not too bad. It's hard to find supplies like this lying around.
Who's buying medical supplies for the best available prices? I've got $what, and I don't have much use for it.
Goddammit $what! I got this for triple the price from some trader the other day.
$what! Finally! Time to heal up.
Found $what. Should I sell it? Or just take it for myself...?
Hey! Didn't one of you almost kick the bucket a second ago? Will $what be of any help?
Let's see what we got here... $what! Nice! That'll be of use.
$what. Not too bad. It's hard to find food like this lying around.
Who wants to buy rations for the best available price? I've got some $what, and I don't have much use for it.
Goddammit... $what! I got this for triple the price from some trader the other day.
$what! Finally! Time to munch.
Oh! Found some $what! About damn time.
Found $what. Should I sell it? Or just take it for myself?
Hey! Just found some chub for anyone who needs it! Will $what be of any help?
$what. Yeah. I've had better days.
$what! Great! My stomach's been rumbling...

This is $speaker. War is still on going in $map. We captured the area $location successfully. Everything is under control for the current time.
Reporting to the general headquarters. The situation in $map has taken a new turn, enemies have retreated following the planned ambush $location. We will guard the place while waiting for new orders.
$speaker speaking. The area $location is secured. Waiting for new orders.
This is $speaker. War is still on going in $map. We captured the area $location successfully. Everything is under control for the current time.
Reporting to the general headquarters. The situation in $map has taken a new turn, enemies have retreated following the planned ambush $location. We will guard the place while waiting for new orders.
$speaker's here. The area $location is under control. The ambush was a big success.
The situation in $map is on fire! We took over the area $location, enemies fell down quickly. $speaker out.
We did it. The place $location is held captive, and those cowards just threw their guns and ran away.
